pages.text: The most basic form of power available to a druid is through spellcraft. Each spell makes use of druid herbs to produce wonderous magic. To do this, a druid must break down reagents in a $(l:apparatus/mortar)Mortar & Pestle$() into a condensed Petal Dust which carries the essence of the spell.

Once a Petal Dust has been crafted, it can be imbued into a simple staff for casting using an $(l:apparatus/imbuer)Imbuer.$() During the imbuement, further reagents can be added to modify the spells effects permenantly. The imbuement will never override the old spell slots, instead it'll install the spell in the first empty spell slot in the staff

pages.title: Spell Staff
pages.text: All spells require a druid to have various herbs in their inventory in order to cast them. These herbs can be provided to the staff through a $(l:apparatus/component_pouch)Component Pouch$() or an $(l:apparatus/apothecary_pouch)Apothecary Pouch$().

pages.title: Casting
pages.text: Casting spells is quite simple. Hold the staff in either hand, right click, and the spell will cast!$(br2)Spells take form in different ways. Some may be brief, insant effects that incur a cooldown before they can be cast again(right-click), and others are only particularly useful if their effect is consistently channeled (hold right-click).

pages.title: Removing Spells
pages.text: In order to remove a spell from a slot in your staff, you can select the relevant slot and then imbue it with $(l:resources/runic_dust)Runic Dust$().
